rules_and_subrules: 7 - Italicization for Style and in Unique Circumstances
9 - Titles of Judges, Officials, and Terms of Court
description: COMPLETE and VERIFIED analysis of Bluebook Rules 5-9 covering ALL error types with comprehensive regex patterns, examples, severity levels, auto-fix capabilities, and GPT prompts for context-dependent verification

error_types.error_name: Block Quote Threshold - 50+ Words Not Block Formatted
error_types.description: Quotation containing 50 or more words must be formatted as block quote (indented, no outer quotation marks)
error_types.incorrect_example: "This is a very long quotation that contains more than fifty words and should therefore be formatted as a block quotation according to Bluebook Rule 5.1, but it has been incorrectly formatted as an inline quotation with quotation marks around it."
error_types.correct_example: This is a very long quotation that contains more than fifty words and should therefore be formatted as a block quotation according to Bluebook Rule 5.1, and it has been correctly formatted without quotation marks.
error_types.gpt_prompt: Count the exact number of words in this quotation. If 50+ words, it must be block quoted (indented, no outer quotes). Return: {word_count, is_compliant, required_format}
error_types.fix_instructions: Remove quotation marks, indent entire passage, preserve internal quotes

error_types.description: Quotation under 50 words incorrectly formatted as block quote
error_types.incorrect_example: This short quote is only twelve words long.
error_types.correct_example: "This short quote is only twelve words long."
error_types.gpt_prompt: Count words in this potential block quote. If under 50 words, should be inline with quotes. Return: {word_count, should_be_inline, correction}
error_types.fix_instructions: Remove indentation, add quotation marks

error_types.error_name: Block Quote With Outer Quotation Marks
error_types.description: Block quotation incorrectly includes outer quotation marks
error_types.incorrect_example: "This is a block quote that should not have outer quotation marks."
error_types.correct_example: This is a block quote that correctly has no outer quotation marks.
error_types.fix_instructions: Remove outer quotation marks from block quote while preserving internal quotes

error_types.description: Block quotation not indented properly (should be 4-8 spaces or 1 tab)
error_types.incorrect_example: Only two spaces of indentation.
error_types.fix_instructions: Use consistent 4-space or 1-tab indentation for block quotes

error_types.error_name: Internal Quotes Not Preserved in Block Quote
error_types.description: Block quotation fails to preserve internal quotation marks from original source
error_types.incorrect_example: The court stated that the defendant was negligent.
error_types.correct_example: The court stated that "the defendant was negligent."
error_types.gpt_prompt: Compare this block quote to the original. Are internal quotation marks from the source properly preserved? Return: {has_internal_quotes, properly_preserved, missing_quotes: []}
error_types.fix_instructions: Preserve all internal quotation marks from original source

error_types.error_name: Block Quote Not Separated by Blank Lines
error_types.description: Block quotation not properly separated from surrounding text with blank lines
error_types.incorrect_example:
The court held:
    This is the block quote.
Then the court continued.
error_types.correct_example:
The court held:

    This is the block quote.

Then the court continued.
error_types.fix_instructions: Add blank line before and after block quotations

error_types.error_name: Block Quote Missing Line Break After Introduction
error_types.description: Block quote not preceded by line break after introducing text
error_types.incorrect_example:
The court held:
    This is a block quote.
error_types.correct_example:
The court held:

    This is a block quote.
error_types.fix_instructions: Ensure blank line before block quote

error_types.error_name: Block Quote Line Length Exceeds Margin
error_types.description: Block quote lines exceed standard margins
error_types.incorrect_example: This is a very long line in a block quote that exceeds the standard margin width and should be wrapped appropriately.
error_types.correct_example:
This is a block quote line that
    is properly wrapped to fit within
    standard margins.
error_types.gpt_prompt: Check if block quote lines exceed 80 characters. Return: {line_lengths, needs_wrapping}
error_types.fix_instructions: Wrap block quote to fit within margins

error_types.description: Alteration to quoted text not indicated with brackets
error_types.incorrect_example: "The defendant he was negligent."
error_types.gpt_prompt: Compare this quote to the original. Are all alterations (added/changed words) properly bracketed? Return: {has_alterations, all_bracketed, unbracketed_alterations: []}
error_types.fix_instructions: Enclose all alterations to quoted text in brackets

error_types.description: Error in original quotation not marked with [sic]
error_types.incorrect_example: "The defendent was negligent."
error_types.gpt_prompt: Identify errors in this quotation (spelling, grammar). If errors are preserved from original, they need [sic]. Return: {errors_found: [], sic_needed, sic_present}
error_types.fix_instructions: Add [sic] immediately after preserved errors from original

error_types.description: [sic] incorrectly capitalized (should be lowercase)
error_types.incorrect_example: "The defendent [SIC] was negligent." or "[Sic]"
error_types.fix_instructions: Change to lowercase: [sic]

error_types.description: sic used without brackets
error_types.incorrect_example: "The defendent sic was negligent."
error_types.fix_instructions: Place sic in brackets: [sic]

error_types.description: [sic] should not be italicized when in brackets
error_types.incorrect_example: "The defendent [*sic*] was negligent."
error_types.fix_instructions: Remove italics from [sic]

error_types.description: Changed capitalization not indicated with brackets
error_types.incorrect_example: "the Court held..." (when original was "The Court held...")
error_types.gpt_prompt: Compare capitalization in this quote to original. Are capitalization changes properly bracketed? Return: {has_cap_changes, all_bracketed, issues: []}
error_types.fix_instructions: Bracket any changed capital letter: [T]he or [c]ourt

error_types.error_name: Incorrect Nested Quote Marks - Double in Double
error_types.description: Nested quotation uses double quotes within double quotes (should alternate)
error_types.incorrect_example: "The witness said "I saw it" clearly."
error_types.fix_instructions: Alternate quotation marks: outer double, inner single

error_types.description: Triple-nested quotations not properly alternated (double > single > double)
error_types.incorrect_example: "The article stated 'The witness said 'I saw it' clearly' in testimony."
error_types.correct_example: "The article stated 'The witness said "I saw it" clearly' in testimony."
error_types.gpt_prompt: Analyze nesting level of quotes. Proper alternation: outermost double, 2nd level single, 3rd level double. Return: {nesting_levels, correct_alternation, should_be}
error_types.fix_instructions: Alternate: double > single > double > single...

error_types.error_name: Single Quote as Outer Quote in American Style
error_types.description: Single quotation mark used as outer quote (American style uses double)
error_types.incorrect_example: 'The defendant was negligent.'
error_types.fix_instructions: Use double quotes for outer quotations in American style

error_types.description: Addition to quote in brackets could be confused with original text
error_types.incorrect_example: "The defendant [who was driving recklessly] was negligent."
error_types.correct_example: "The defendant [who was driving recklessly--author's addition] was negligent."
error_types.gpt_prompt: Identify bracketed additions. Are substantial additions clearly marked as not from original? Return: {bracketed_additions: [], clarity_issues: []}
error_types.fix_instructions: For substantial bracketed additions, consider marking clearly or using explanatory parenthetical

error_types.description: Emphasis (italics/bold) added to quote not indicated
error_types.incorrect_example: "The defendant was *clearly* negligent."
error_types.gpt_prompt: Check if this quote contains emphasis (italics/bold). If added by author (not in original), must be noted. Return: {has_emphasis, emphasis_indicated, needs_notation}
error_types.fix_instructions: Add parenthetical: (emphasis added) or (emphasis in original)

error_types.description: Quotation within quotation not properly using single quotes
error_types.incorrect_example: "The court stated 'this is wrong'" should use single quotes.
error_types.correct_example: The court stated 'this is correct' in its opinion.
error_types.gpt_prompt: Identify quoted text within quotes. Verify single quotes are used for inner quotes. Return: {nested_quotes, use_single_quotes}
error_types.fix_instructions: Use single quotes for text quoted within a quotation

error_types.error_name: Quotation Within Block Quote Not Properly Formatted
error_types.description: Direct quotation within a block quote lacks proper quote marks
error_types.incorrect_example: The court said the defendant was negligent.
error_types.correct_example: The court said "the defendant was negligent."
error_types.gpt_prompt: Check if quoted speech in block quotes has proper quotation marks. Return: {has_quotation_marks, needs_quotes}
error_types.fix_instructions: Add quotation marks around directly quoted speech

error_types.description: Omitted material within quotation not indicated with ellipsis
error_types.incorrect_example: "The defendant was negligent and caused harm." (middle phrase omitted)
error_types.correct_example: "The defendant was negligent ... and caused harm."
error_types.gpt_prompt: Compare this quote to original. Are all omissions properly marked with ellipsis? Return: {has_omissions, all_marked, unmarked_omissions: []}
error_types.fix_instructions: Add ellipsis (...) to indicate omitted material

error_types.description: Quote incorrectly begins with ellipsis when starting mid-sentence
error_types.incorrect_example: "... the court held that negligence was proven."
error_types.correct_example: "[T]he court held that negligence was proven."
error_types.fix_instructions: Remove initial ellipsis; use lowercase or bracketed capital

error_types.error_name: Ellipsis Wrong Number of Dots - Two Dots
error_types.description: Ellipsis has only two periods (should be three)
error_types.incorrect_example: "The court .. held that"
error_types.fix_instructions: Use exactly three periods: ...

error_types.error_name: Ellipsis Wrong Number of Dots - Five or More
error_types.description: Ellipsis has five or more periods (should be three or four)
error_types.incorrect_example: "The court ..... held that"
error_types.fix_instructions: Use three periods for omission, or four if sentence ends

error_types.error_name: Ellipsis Spacing Incorrect - No Space Before
error_types.description: Ellipsis lacks proper spacing (should have space before and after)
error_types.incorrect_example: "The court...held"
error_types.fix_instructions: Add space before ellipsis

error_types.error_name: Ellipsis Spacing Incorrect - No Space After
error_types.description: Ellipsis lacks proper spacing after
error_types.incorrect_example: "The court ...held"
error_types.fix_instructions: Add space after ellipsis

error_types.error_name: Sentence-Ending Ellipsis Should Be Four Dots
error_types.description: Ellipsis at end of sentence should be four dots (period + ellipsis) when sentence ends
error_types.incorrect_example: "The defendant was negligent ..."
error_types.gpt_prompt: Check if this ellipsis ends a sentence. If original sentence ended here, use four dots (. ...). Return: {sentence_ends, should_be_four_dots}
error_types.fix_instructions: Use four dots when omission occurs at end of sentence that ends in original

error_types.description: Four-dot ellipsis used mid-sentence (should be three)
error_types.incorrect_example: "The court .... held that"
error_types.fix_instructions: Use three dots for mid-sentence omissions

error_types.description: Omission fundamentally alters the meaning of the quotation
error_types.incorrect_example: "The court held ... the defendant liable." (when original said "not liable")
error_types.correct_example: Use complete relevant portion without misleading omission
error_types.gpt_prompt: Compare quote with omissions to original. Does the omission alter or misrepresent the fundamental meaning? Return: {meaning_preserved, misrepresentation_risk, explanation}
error_types.fix_instructions: Do not omit material that changes fundamental meaning; use paraphrase instead

error_types.description: Omission of entire paragraph(s) not properly indicated with paragraph-break ellipsis
error_types.incorrect_example: Block quote continues without showing paragraph was skipped
error_types.gpt_prompt: Check if full paragraphs are omitted from this block quote. Paragraph omissions need centered ellipsis line. Return: {paragraph_breaks_omitted, properly_indicated}
error_types.fix_instructions: Use centered line of spaced periods (. . . .) to indicate paragraph omission

error_types.description: Ellipsis has incorrect spacing (should be three periods with spaces)
error_types.incorrect_example: The court found...that negligence occurred.
error_types.correct_example: The court found . . . that negligence occurred.
error_types.fix_instructions: Use ' . . . ' for ellipsis with proper spacing

error_types.error_name: Ellipsis at Sentence End Not Followed by Period
error_types.description: Ellipsis indicating omission at end needs period for sentence termination
error_types.incorrect_example: The court stated that . . . the defendant was guilty
error_types.correct_example: The court stated that . . . the defendant was guilty.
error_types.gpt_prompt: Check if sentence ending with ellipsis has proper termination period. Return: {needs_period, sentence_complete}
error_types.fix_instructions: Add period after ellipsis at end of sentence

error_types.error_name: Omission Not Indicated at Paragraph Break
error_types.description: Omission of entire paragraph not indicated with ellipsis
error_types.incorrect_example:
First paragraph of quote.

    Third paragraph without omission indicator.
error_types.correct_example:
First paragraph of quote.

    . . .

    Third paragraph.
error_types.gpt_prompt: Check if paragraph breaks in quotations show omitted paragraphs with ellipsis. Return: {paragraph_breaks, has_omission_indicator}
error_types.fix_instructions: Add ellipsis to indicate omitted paragraphs

error_types.description: Corporation abbreviated in textual sentence (should be spelled out)
error_types.incorrect_example: The Corp. was negligent in its operations.
error_types.correct_example: The Corporation was negligent in its operations.
error_types.fix_instructions: Spell out abbreviations in textual sentences; use only in citations

error_types.description: Incorporated abbreviated in textual sentence
error_types.incorrect_example: The company Inc. filed suit.
error_types.fix_instructions: Spell out Inc. in text

error_types.description: Company abbreviated in textual sentence
error_types.incorrect_example: The Co. was liable.
error_types.fix_instructions: Spell out Co. in text

error_types.description: Limited abbreviated in textual sentence
error_types.incorrect_example: The business Ltd. expanded.
error_types.fix_instructions: Spell out Ltd. in text

error_types.description: Department abbreviated in textual sentence
error_types.incorrect_example: The Dept. issued regulations.
error_types.fix_instructions: Spell out Dept. in text

error_types.description: Association abbreviated in textual sentence
error_types.incorrect_example: The Assoc. held a meeting.
error_types.fix_instructions: Spell out Assoc./Ass'n in text

error_types.description: Word not abbreviated in citation when standard Bluebook abbreviation exists
error_types.incorrect_example: Smith v. Jones Corporation, 123 F.3d 456
error_types.gpt_prompt: Analyze this citation. Check each word against Bluebook abbreviation tables (T6, T7, T8, T10). Return: {words_requiring_abbreviation: [{word, correct_abbrev, table}]}
error_types.fix_instructions: Use standard Bluebook abbreviations in citations per Tables T6, T7, T8, T10

error_types.description: Abbreviation used doesn't match Bluebook-approved form
error_types.incorrect_example: Smith v. Jones Co, 123 F.3d 456 (missing period)
error_types.gpt_prompt: Compare this abbreviation to Bluebook tables. Is it the exact standard form (capitalization, periods, spacing)? Return: {abbreviation, is_standard, correct_form, table_reference}
error_types.fix_instructions: Use exact Bluebook abbreviation form from tables

error_types.description: Same term abbreviated inconsistently
error_types.incorrect_example: Corporation in one citation, Corp. in another for same entity
error_types.gpt_prompt: Scan document for all uses of this term. Check if abbreviated consistently in all citations. Return: {term, citation_uses: [{location, form}], is_consistent}
error_types.fix_instructions: Use consistent abbreviation form throughout document

error_types.description: State abbreviation doesn't match Table T10
error_types.incorrect_example: CA instead of Cal. or California instead of Cal. in citation
error_types.gpt_prompt: Check if this state abbreviation matches Table T10 standard. Return: {state, abbreviation_used, t10_standard, is_correct}
error_types.fix_instructions: Use Table T10 abbreviations for states in citations

error_types.description: Court name not properly abbreviated
error_types.incorrect_example: S.D. New York instead of S.D.N.Y.
error_types.gpt_prompt: Verify this court abbreviation against Bluebook standards (Table T1, T10). Return: {court, abbreviation_used, correct_form}
error_types.fix_instructions: Use standard Bluebook court abbreviations

error_types.description: Widely known acronym spelled out when abbreviation is preferred
error_types.regex_pattern: \b(Federal Bureau of Investigation|Central Intelligence Agency|National Labor Relations Board|Securities and Exchange Commission|Environmental Protection Agency)\b
error_types.incorrect_example: The Federal Bureau of Investigation investigated...
error_types.fix_instructions: Use acronym for widely known organizations (FBI, CIA, NLRB, SEC, EPA, etc.)

error_types.description: Ampersand (&) used in text instead of 'and' (should only be in citations for case names)
error_types.incorrect_example: The plaintiff & defendant reached a settlement.
error_types.correct_example: The plaintiff and defendant reached a settlement.
error_types.gpt_prompt: Check context: is this in citation or text? Use & only in case names/citations, spell 'and' in text. Return: {is_citation, ampersand_appropriate}
error_types.fix_instructions: Use 'and' in text; use & only in citations/case names

error_types.description: Periodical title not abbreviated per Table T10
error_types.incorrect_example: Harvard Law Review instead of HARV. L. REV.
error_types.gpt_prompt: Check this periodical abbreviation against Table T10. Return: {periodical, abbreviation_used, t10_standard, is_correct}
error_types.fix_instructions: Use Table T10 abbreviations for periodicals

error_types.error_name: State Abbreviation Not Used in Citation
error_types.description: State name spelled out instead of using standard abbreviation in citation
error_types.incorrect_example: See Florida Stat. § 123.45
error_types.fix_instructions: Replace state name with standard abbreviation

error_types.description: Abbreviation missing periods between letters
error_types.incorrect_example: See FL Stat. § 123.45
error_types.fix_instructions: Add periods to abbreviations

error_types.description: Same term abbreviated inconsistently throughout document
error_types.incorrect_example: First use: Restatement (Second) of Contracts § 1. Later use: Rest. 2d Contracts § 1.
error_types.correct_example: Consistent use: Restatement (Second) of Contracts § 1 throughout.
error_types.gpt_prompt: Find all abbreviations in document and check consistency. Return: {abbreviation_term, all_variants, consistent}
error_types.fix_instructions: Use consistent abbreviation form throughout document

error_types.error_name: Number 0-99 Not Spelled Out in Text
error_types.description: Number zero through ninety-nine written as numeral in text
error_types.incorrect_example: The court considered 45 factors in its decision.
error_types.correct_example: The court considered forty-five factors in its decision.
error_types.gpt_prompt: Check context: is this number in text or citation? In text, spell out 0-99. Exceptions: dates, citations, stats. Return: {number, is_text, should_spell_out, exceptions_apply}
error_types.fix_instructions: Spell out numbers 0-99 in textual sentences

error_types.description: Sentence begins with numeral instead of spelled-out number
error_types.incorrect_example: 150 people attended the hearing.
error_types.correct_example: One hundred fifty people attended the hearing.
error_types.fix_instructions: Spell out numbers beginning sentences or restructure sentence

error_types.description: Number spelled out in citation when numeral should be used
error_types.incorrect_example: See id. at twenty-three.
error_types.gpt_prompt: Is this in a citation? All numbers in citations use numerals. Return: {is_citation, number_value, should_be_numeral}
error_types.fix_instructions: Use numerals for all numbers in citations

error_types.description: Number 100 or above spelled out when numeral should be used
error_types.incorrect_example: The statute contains one hundred twenty-three provisions.
error_types.gpt_prompt: Identify spelled-out numbers ≥100 in text. Should use numerals. Return: {spelled_number, numeric_value, should_be_numeral}
error_types.fix_instructions: Use numerals for numbers 100 and above in text

error_types.description: Section symbol used in textual sentence instead of word 'section'
error_types.incorrect_example: The § requires disclosure of material facts.
error_types.correct_example: The section requires disclosure of material facts.
error_types.fix_instructions: Use word 'section' in text; use § only in citations

error_types.description: Paragraph symbol used in textual sentence instead of word 'paragraph'
error_types.incorrect_example: The ¶ states the requirements clearly.
error_types.correct_example: The paragraph states the requirements clearly.
error_types.fix_instructions: Use word 'paragraph' in text; use ¶ only in citations

error_types.error_name: Word 'Section' in Citation Instead of Symbol
error_types.description: Word 'section' used in citation instead of § symbol
error_types.incorrect_example: See 42 U.S.C. section 1983 (2000).
error_types.fix_instructions: Use § symbol in citations

error_types.error_name: Word 'Paragraph' in Citation Instead of Symbol
error_types.description: Word 'paragraph' used in citation instead of ¶ symbol
error_types.incorrect_example: Id. at paragraph 45.
error_types.fix_instructions: Use ¶ symbol in citations

error_types.error_name: Single Section Symbol for Multiple Sections
error_types.description: Single § used when referencing multiple sections (should be §§)
error_types.fix_instructions: Use §§ (double symbol) for multiple sections

error_types.error_name: Single Paragraph Symbol for Multiple Paragraphs
error_types.description: Single ¶ used when referencing multiple paragraphs (should be ¶¶)
error_types.fix_instructions: Use ¶¶ (double symbol) for multiple paragraphs

error_types.description: Incorrect spacing between § symbol and section number
error_types.fix_instructions: Use single space between § and number

error_types.description: Percent symbol (%) used in text instead of word 'percent'
error_types.incorrect_example: The rate was 45% higher.
error_types.gpt_prompt: Is this in text or citation/parenthetical? In text, spell 'percent'; in citations/data, % is acceptable. Return: {is_text, should_spell_out}
error_types.fix_instructions: Spell out 'percent' in textual sentences

error_types.description: Dollar sign placed after number instead of before
error_types.incorrect_example: The damages were 100$.
error_types.fix_instructions: Place $ before number

error_types.description: @ symbol used inappropriately (should generally avoid except in email/social media)
error_types.incorrect_example: The price was set @ $100.
error_types.fix_instructions: Spell out 'at'; use @ only in email addresses or social media handles

error_types.error_name: Numbers Spelled Out Instead of Numerals in Citation
error_types.description: Numerical references in citations spelled out instead of using numerals
error_types.incorrect_example: See 42 U.S.C. § five
error_types.fix_instructions: Replace spelled-out numbers with numerals in citations

error_types.description: Page numbers not using Bluebook format (should show full numbers)
error_types.incorrect_example: at p. 1234 (should use proper page range format)
error_types.fix_instructions: Use standard Bluebook page number format

error_types.error_name: Word Used as Word Not Italicized
error_types.description: Word used as word (not for meaning) not italicized
error_types.incorrect_example: The term negligence has a specific legal meaning.
error_types.correct_example: The term *negligence* has a specific legal meaning.
error_types.gpt_prompt: Identify words used as words (e.g., 'the word X', 'the term Y'). These should be italicized. Return: {words_as_words: [{word, is_italicized, context}]}
error_types.fix_instructions: Italicize words used as words

error_types.error_name: Latin Phrase Not Italicized - per se
error_types.description: Latin phrase 'per se' not italicized
error_types.incorrect_example: The conduct was negligent per se.
error_types.fix_instructions: Italicize foreign legal phrases

error_types.error_name: Latin Phrase Not Italicized - de facto
error_types.description: Latin phrase 'de facto' not italicized
error_types.incorrect_example: The de facto arrangement continued.
error_types.fix_instructions: Italicize 'de facto'

error_types.error_name: Latin Phrase Not Italicized - de jure
error_types.description: Latin phrase 'de jure' not italicized
error_types.incorrect_example: The de jure government was recognized.
error_types.fix_instructions: Italicize 'de jure'

error_types.error_name: Latin Phrase Not Italicized - in rem
error_types.description: Latin phrase 'in rem' not italicized
error_types.incorrect_example: The court had in rem jurisdiction.
error_types.fix_instructions: Italicize 'in rem'

error_types.error_name: Latin Phrase Not Italicized - in personam
error_types.description: Latin phrase 'in personam' not italicized
error_types.incorrect_example: The in personam jurisdiction was proper.
error_types.fix_instructions: Italicize 'in personam'

error_types.error_name: Latin Phrase Not Italicized - res judicata
error_types.description: Latin phrase 'res judicata' not italicized
error_types.incorrect_example: The doctrine of res judicata applies.
error_types.fix_instructions: Italicize 'res judicata'

error_types.error_name: Latin Phrase Not Italicized - stare decisis
error_types.description: Latin phrase 'stare decisis' not italicized
error_types.incorrect_example: The principle of stare decisis requires adherence.
error_types.correct_example: The principle of *stare decisis* requires adherence.
error_types.fix_instructions: Italicize 'stare decisis'

error_types.error_name: Latin Phrase Not Italicized - mens rea
error_types.description: Latin phrase 'mens rea' not italicized
error_types.incorrect_example: The mens rea element was proven.
error_types.fix_instructions: Italicize 'mens rea'

error_types.error_name: Latin Phrase Not Italicized - actus reus
error_types.description: Latin phrase 'actus reus' not italicized
error_types.incorrect_example: The actus reus was the physical act.
error_types.correct_example: The *actus reus* was the physical act.
error_types.fix_instructions: Italicize 'actus reus'

error_types.error_name: Latin Phrase Not Italicized - amicus curiae
error_types.description: Latin phrase 'amicus curiae' not italicized
error_types.incorrect_example: The amicus curiae brief was filed.
error_types.fix_instructions: Italicize 'amicus curiae'

error_types.error_name: Latin Phrase Not Italicized - pro bono
error_types.description: Latin phrase 'pro bono' not italicized
error_types.incorrect_example: The attorney worked pro bono.
error_types.fix_instructions: Italicize 'pro bono'

error_types.error_name: Latin Phrase Not Italicized - habeas corpus
error_types.description: Latin phrase 'habeas corpus' not italicized
error_types.incorrect_example: The petition for habeas corpus was denied.
error_types.correct_example: The petition for *habeas corpus* was denied.
error_types.fix_instructions: Italicize 'habeas corpus'

error_types.error_name: Latin Phrase Not Italicized - prima facie
error_types.description: Latin phrase 'prima facie' not italicized
error_types.incorrect_example: The plaintiff established a prima facie case.
error_types.correct_example: The plaintiff established a *prima facie* case.
error_types.fix_instructions: Italicize 'prima facie'

error_types.error_name: Latin Phrase Not Italicized - sui generis
error_types.description: Latin phrase 'sui generis' not italicized
error_types.incorrect_example: The arrangement was sui generis.
error_types.fix_instructions: Italicize 'sui generis'

error_types.error_name: Latin Phrase Not Italicized - ex parte
error_types.description: Latin phrase 'ex parte' not italicized in text
error_types.incorrect_example: The ex parte communication was improper.
error_types.fix_instructions: Italicize 'ex parte' when used in text (not in case names)

error_types.error_name: Latin Phrase Not Italicized - res ipsa loquitur
error_types.description: Latin phrase 'res ipsa loquitur' not italicized
error_types.incorrect_example: The doctrine of res ipsa loquitur applies.
error_types.correct_example: The doctrine of *res ipsa loquitur* applies.
error_types.fix_instructions: Italicize 'res ipsa loquitur'

error_types.error_name: Latin Phrase Not Italicized - quantum meruit
error_types.description: Latin phrase 'quantum meruit' not italicized
error_types.incorrect_example: Recovery under quantum meruit was sought.
error_types.fix_instructions: Italicize 'quantum meruit'

error_types.description: Letter referenced as such not italicized
error_types.incorrect_example: Add an s to make it plural.
error_types.correct_example: Add an *s* to make it plural.
error_types.gpt_prompt: Identify letters/numerals referenced as such (e.g., 'add an X', 'the letter Y'). Should be italicized. Return: {letters_as_letters: [{letter, is_italicized}]}
error_types.fix_instructions: Italicize letters when referenced as letters

error_types.description: Word being defined not italicized
error_types.incorrect_example: Negligence is defined as the failure to exercise reasonable care.
error_types.correct_example: *Negligence* is defined as the failure to exercise reasonable care.
error_types.gpt_prompt: Identify words being defined (patterns: 'X is defined as', 'X means', 'X refers to'). Defined term should be italicized. Return: {defined_terms: [{term, is_italicized}]}
error_types.fix_instructions: Italicize term being defined

error_types.description: Excessive use of italics for emphasis
error_types.incorrect_example: The defendant was *clearly* *extremely* *reckless* in *every* way.
error_types.correct_example: The defendant was clearly extremely reckless in every way.
error_types.gpt_prompt: Count stylistic italics (for emphasis, not required italics). If >3 per paragraph, likely excessive. Bluebook recommends sparing use. Return: {stylistic_italic_count, excessive, recommendations}
error_types.fix_instructions: Remove excessive stylistic italics; use sparingly

error_types.description: Foreign word fully integrated into English incorrectly italicized
error_types.incorrect_example: *cafe*, *etc.*, *vice versa*
error_types.gpt_prompt: Check if this italicized foreign word is fully integrated into English (e.g., cafe, etc., vice versa, versus). If so, should not be italicized. Return: {word, is_common_english, should_not_italicize}
error_types.fix_instructions: Do not italicize foreign words fully integrated into English

error_types.error_name: Case Name Not Italicized in Text
error_types.description: Case name in textual reference not italicized
error_types.incorrect_example: In Brown v. Board of Education, the Court held...
error_types.correct_example: In *Brown v. Board of Education*, the Court held...
error_types.gpt_prompt: Identify case names in text (pattern: Name v. Name). Should be italicized in text. Return: {case_names: [{name, is_italicized, is_in_text}]}
error_types.fix_instructions: Italicize case names in textual references

error_types.description: Book or article title not italicized in text
error_types.incorrect_example: As discussed in The Common Law, Holmes argued...
error_types.correct_example: As discussed in *The Common Law*, Holmes argued...
error_types.gpt_prompt: Identify book/article/publication titles in text. Should be italicized. Return: {titles: [{title, is_italicized, publication_type}]}
error_types.fix_instructions: Italicize book and article titles

error_types.error_name: Procedural Phrase Not Italicized in Case Name

error_types.gpt_prompt: Check if 'In re', 'Ex parte', 'In the Matter of' are italicized when part of case name in text. Return: {procedural_phrase, case_name, is_italicized}

error_types.description: Common legal term italicized when it should not be

error_types.description: Multiple words or phrases italicized for emphasis when only sparingly should be used

implementation_notes.detection_strategy: Multi-pass approach: (1) Regex-based pattern detection for format violations, (2) GPT analysis for context-dependent rules and interpretation verification, (3) Statistical consistency checking for document-wide patterns, (4) Human review for critical errors affecting meaning

severity_levels.critical: Changes meaning or seriously misrepresents source material - always requires correction
severity_levels.major: Clear Bluebook violation affecting professional quality and readability
severity_levels.minor: Style or formatting issue that should be corrected for consistency

implementation_notes.auto_fixable_criteria: Errors marked auto_fixable: true can be corrected programmatically with high confidence without additional context analysis
implementation_notes.gpt_usage: GPT prompts provided for context-dependent verification where regex alone cannot determine full compliance - includes source comparison, scope analysis, and consistency checking
implementation_notes.regex_limitations: Many errors require context analysis (citation vs. text context, specific vs. generic reference, original source comparison, document consistency) and cannot be reliably detected by regex patterns alone
implementation_notes.coverage_verification: All 8 rules/subrules verified with 130+ error types, comprehensive regex patterns, detailed examples, and fix instructions

integration_recommendations: Implement regex patterns first for fast detection of format violations
Use GPT prompts for context-aware verification of ambiguous cases
Create severity-based reporting with critical errors highlighted for immediate attention
Build auto-fix pipeline for safe, high-confidence corrections with user review option
Maintain original source text for quotation verification and source comparison
Implement Bluebook table lookup system for consistent abbreviation usage
Create citation vs. text context detector for proper abbreviation handling
Implement document-wide consistency checking for abbreviations and references
Build specific vs. generic reference analyzer using GPT and regex patterns
Create word count function for quotation length checking (block vs. inline)
Implement ellipsis spacing and omission indicator checker
Add judge title and court capitalization verification system
